Let's move forward on our journey learning Japanese. This lesson focuses on practicing conversations at a tourist spot.
Imagine you are visiting the iconic Fushimi Inari Taisha in Kyoto and you meet a fellow tourist. This lesson will help you to conduct a basic conversation in such a situation.
The first phrase we'll learn is 'Where are you from?', which in Japanese is

lang.mstts:prosody: あなたはどこから来ましたか

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: . Let's go over that again: 'Where are you from?' is

lang.mstts:prosody: あなたはどこから来ましたか

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang:
.
If you were the person being asked, you could for instance respond: 'I am from America', translating to:

lang.mstts:prosody: 私はアメリカから来ました

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: . One more time, 'I am from America' is:

lang.mstts:prosody: 私はアメリカから来ました

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang:
.
A common follow-up question would be 'Is this your first time in Japan?', which in Japanese is:

lang.mstts:prosody: これは日本への初めての旅行ですか

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: . Let's repeat: 'Is this your first time in Japan?' is:

lang.mstts:prosody: これは日本への初めての旅行ですか

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang:
.
You might want to respond with: 'Yes, it's my first time. It's beautiful here', translating in Japanese to:

lang.mstts:prosody: はい、初めてです。ここは美しいですね

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: . One more time, 'Yes, it's my first time. It's beautiful here' is:

lang.mstts:prosody: はい、初めてです。ここは美しいですね

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang:
.
And to continue the conversation, you might ask 'Where have you visited in Japan?', which is:

lang.mstts:prosody: あなたは日本のどこを訪れましたか

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: . Let's repeat that: 'Where have you visited in Japan?' is:

lang.mstts:prosody: あなたは日本のどこを訪れましたか

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang:
.
This concludes our lesson. You've now learned the basics of conversing at a tourist spot in Japan. Continue practicing these phrases to consolidate your understanding.
